name: Grammatica
tagline: Grammatica is a C# and Java parser generator (compiler compiler)
body:
Grammatica improves upon simlar tools (like yacc and ANTLR)...

* by creating well-commented and readable source code,
* by having automatic error recovery and detailed error messages,
* and by support for testing and debugging grammars without generating source code.

See the wiki page [Why use Grammatica?](https://github.com/cederberg/grammatica/wiki/Why-Use-Grammatica)
for reasons to use or avoid  Grammatica.


# Documentation

* [Release Documentation](doc/index.html) – Instructions on installation and running. This documentation is also available in the download package.
* [Reference Manual](doc/manual/index.html) – The detailed documentation for using Grammatica. This documentation is also available in the download package.
* [Java API Documentation](doc/api/java/index.html) – The API for Java parsers. This documentation is also available in the download package.
* [.NET API Documentation](doc/api/csharp/index.html) – The API for .NET (C#) parsers. This documentation is also available in the download package.


# Releases & Versions

* [Releases on GitHub](https://github.com/cederberg/grammatica/releases).


# License

Grammatica is open source software released under the permissive BSD license. This provides full access to the source code, permits changes and allows for unlimited redistribution and usage in commercial applications.
